item.title: GaW - Heroes of Might & Magic
item.description:
Heroes of Might & Magic III is one of my all time favourite games. It proposes 4 core systesms (heroes, castles, exploration and combat) each feeding each other to create a hollistic and compelling gameplay. Trying to imitate it in one week was both challenging and incredibly fun.

item.title: Game a Week Challenge - Rules
item.description:
What is the “Game In A Week” Challenge? 🕹️

Game in a Week (GaW) is a self-imposed challenge to build a bitching prototype for an existing game (preferably a genre-defining one). It’s an undertaking in which I show that quick prototyping is easy,fun, and can yield great results. I hope both you and I will learn a lot along the way.

Structure 🛠️

We will start by reverse-designing the game. We’ll understand what systems comprise gameplay and what needs to be done in terms of code, tech art, and assets. We will also analyze the gameplay, defining interactions, events, and dynamics.

item.title: Bow & Arrow
item.description:
“Hear ye! Hear ye! The king is looking for the best archer in the land! Are you up for a challenge of Bow & Arrow?
Genre Tech Stack Platform Role Status Employer
Arcade, Puzzle Unity, C#, SteamVR VR Sole Developer & Designer Sold (Private Buyer) Kubiyax

Overview

Bow & Arrow is a fairly simple game. As I remember 2017, it was the dawn of VR games. Not that weren’t made before, but mechanics and dynamics still haven’t been fully explored. Many VR arcades looked for a cutting edge, propietry games that players could play only in that specific arcade. Bow & Arrow was one of those games.

item.title: Neuroderm
item.description:
Make your way through obstacles and learn a couple of things while at it!
Genre Tech Stack Platform Role Status Client
Casual Unity, C# PC, Touch Screens Sole Developer Completed Neuroderm

Overview

This flappy bird look-a-like is teaching us about the problems of current Parkinson medication and how they might be solved. The real pride of this project on my side, beyond the tight schedule, is the music and SFX that I composed 🙂. The game was developed over a 24 hour preriod!
